overview.description: This assessment evaluates understanding of fundamental artificial intelligence concepts covered during Week 1 of Mission: AI Possible. Participants will demonstrate knowledge of AI history, key systems, technology relationships, and core capabilities including Machine Learning and Deep Learning.
learningObjectives: Understand the historical milestones in AI development
Distinguish between AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning
Identify key AI systems and their achievements
Recognize fundamental AI capabilities and limitations
Understand the role of training data in Machine Learning
Identify types of bias in AI and mitigation strategies
prerequisites: Week 1: Fundamentals of AI course material

questions.text: Which system beat world chess champion Garry Kasparov in 1997?

options.label: C
options.reasoning: IBM Deep Blue defeated world chess champion Garry Kasparov in May 1997 in a six-game match held in New York City, marking a significant milestone in AI history. This victory demonstrated that AI systems could master complex, strategic games in defined domains, paving the way for future developments in narrow AI applications.

questions.text: Deep Learning models rely on multilayered neural networks that are capable of handling large, unstructured data sets.

options.label: True
options.reasoning: Deep Learning is characterized by its use of multilayered (deep) neural networks that excel at processing large volumes of unstructured data such as images, text, and audio. These architectures can automatically extract hierarchical features from raw data, making them particularly effective for complex pattern recognition tasks.

questions.text: Frank Rosenblatt's Mark 1 Perceptron, built in 1967, was based on which conceptual network?

options.label: C
options.reasoning: The Mark 1 Perceptron was based on the concept of artificial neural networks, inspired by biological neurons. Rosenblatt's work demonstrated early machine learning capabilities through a hardware implementation that could learn to recognize patterns, laying groundwork for modern neural network architectures.

questions.text: Because Machine Learning requires data for training, it is not considered part of the broader field of Artificial Intelligence.

options.label: False
options.reasoning: This statement is false. Machine Learning is definitively a subset of Artificial Intelligence. ML represents one approach to achieving AI by using data-driven algorithms to learn patterns and make decisions, rather than relying solely on explicitly programmed rules. It is an integral component of the broader AI field.

questions.text: Which statement best describes the relationship between AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning?

options.label: A
options.text: AI is a subset of Machine Learning

options.label: B
options.text: Deep Learning came before Machine Learning historically

options.label: C
options.text: Machine Learning and Deep Learning are subsets of AI, with Deep Learning being a subset of Machine Learning
options.reasoning: The correct hierarchical relationship places Artificial Intelligence as the broadest concept, with Machine Learning as a subset of AI focused on data-driven learning approaches. Deep Learning is a further subset of Machine Learning that specifically uses multilayered neural networks. This nested relationship reflects both the conceptual and historical development of these technologies.

options.label: D
options.text: They are three separate, unrelated technologies

questions.text: In the context of AI development, what is the primary purpose of a training dataset?

options.label: A
options.text: To store the AI model's predictions for future use

options.label: B
options.text: To test the final performance of an AI model

options.label: C
options.text: To provide examples that allow the model to learn patterns and relationships
options.reasoning: The training dataset's primary purpose is to provide examples from which the AI model can learn patterns, relationships, and features relevant to the task at hand. During training, the model adjusts its internal parameters to minimize errors on these examples, enabling it to generalize and make accurate predictions on new, unseen data.

options.label: D
options.text: To benchmark the model against competing AI systems
